description:
Job Description: Environmental Science Technician (Biology Focus)

Position Title: Environmental Science Technician

Employment Type: Part Time

Reports To: Senior Environmental Scientist/Project Manager

Company Overview:

Stell is dedicated to preserving the environment through innovative solutions and rigorous scientific research. Our team is committed to addressing environmental challenges and promoting sustainable practices. We specialize in various environmental services, including biological assessments, habitat restoration, and environmental impact studies.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced and detail\\-oriented Mid\\-Level Environmental Science Technician with a focus on biology to join our team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in conducting environmental assessments, collecting and analyzing biological samples, and supporting various environmental projects. This position offers opportunities for increased responsibility and leadership in project execution and management.

Key Responsibilities:

* Fieldwork:
* Lead the collection of samples from various environments.
* Conduct detailed surveys and monitoring of plant or animal species.
* Coordinate and participate in habitat restoration projects, including planning and maintenance activities, including mitigation plans and surveys.
* Autonomously ensures proper operation, calibration, and maintenance of field equipment and instruments.
* Laboratory Work:
* Oversee the preparation and analysis of samples using advanced techniques.
* Ensure accurate recording and organization of data, maintaining high standards of data quality.
* Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations based on laboratory findings and field data.

* Manage and analyze data using database software, GIS tools, and spreadsheets preferred.

* Ensure all field and laboratory work complies with relevant environmental regulations and standards.
* Demonstrated experience with major laws, regulations and processes to include permitting.
* Maintain thorough records of field and laboratory activities, ensuring all documentation is up to date.
* Team Collaboration and Leadership:
* Mentor and provide guidance to junior technicians and interns.
* Collaborate effectively with project managers, senior scientists, and other team members.
* Communicate project progress, findings, and challenges to stakeholders.

* Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Biology, Ecology, or a related field. Advanced coursework or certifications are a plus.
* Strong understanding of environmental science principles and biological concepts.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and experience with GIS software.
* Experience in RStudio and Python or similar preferred
* Excellent organizational and time\\-management skills.
* Ability to work independently and lead a team.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Willingness to work outdoors in various weather conditions.
* Experience:
* 2\\-5 years of relevant fieldwork and laboratory experience in environmental science or a related field.
* Demonstrated experience in data analysis and report writing.
* Experience with project management, leadership roles, programming languages and AI machine learning is preferred.

Working Conditions:

* Must be comfortable working in water, swimming/snorkeling
* Must be able to work year\\-round in various outdoor environments, sometimes under physically demanding conditions.
* May require occasional travel to remote field sites.
* Flexibility to work outside standard business hours as needed.

Please submit a cover letter, indicating salary requirements and availability, along with your resume to careers@stellee.com.

Stell is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

description:
At U.S. Bank, we're on a journey to do our best. This includes design and execution of policies, standards, and internal procedures for all phases of model life cycle from identification and inventorying to implementation, maintenance, and retirement. MRG provides oversight of model development, Validation and reports on the Bank's overall model risk. The responsibilities of this Quantitative Model Analyst include:
